subject: Re: Plugins for SGUA and PIP

full_threads.body:
Hi Sree,

Thanks for following up, yes this will be fine, we can handle it at our end.

When the site is ready to go live, please be sure to reference this email so that nothing is lost in translation.

Hi Heath,

Hope you are doing well.

I did not receive any response for my query below.

Is there any issue with this?

Thanks.

Sreetheran Nair | IT Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus E:Sreetheran.Nair@theproplab.com.au



www.sgua.com.au



www.pi-plus.com.au



The contents of this email (including any attachments) are confidential and may contain privileged information. Any unauthorised use of the contents is expressly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately by Telephone or Email, and then destroy the mail and any attachments or documents.

Thank you so much Heath for getting us up and running.

Just an update from our side, we are busy finalising the last of the content changes as well as adding some custom & Gravity forms.

We will let you know once all changes have been made and indicative timings of when we are expecting to go live.

We were also supplied the below from Fuller which I thought I would pass on in case 🙂

Thank you again,

==========

I have also provided a link to the redirects map. I realised as you are changing domains, we cannot manage the redirect process for your old domain on our end. You will need to have this map uploaded to your existing website, right after the new website goes live. We usually recommend to do the following after go live of the new website:

1. Upload redirects to old website (leaving the host activated)
2. Change website robots txt / Wordpress read settings to stop indexing via search engines
3. Leave the site running with redirects for approx 12 weeks - just allowing time for the new site to index and the old one to un-index.

Your existing host might have a different recommendation to manage this, so please liaise with them on the best way to ensure SEO is maintained. The below google file is comment only but they can take a copy / edit and download as CSV, ready to upload. Any links for portals also need to be managed by their own host, so you will need to engage them on any portal link changes that may be affected.

PIP Domain Redirects Map

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au



www.sgua.com.au



www.pi-plus.com.au

https://www.pi-plus.com.au/paybill/
And

paul@anomaly.digital

Hi Megs,

I have added yourself and Sree as users. Let me know if you don't recieve the emails to confirm your accounts.

Regarding the backend login link, we will update it as part of the go-live process.

When you are ready to go live, just let us know and we will make the switch. It will only take approx 1 hrs.

Finally, can I ask you to please send these DNS instructions to your IT company. These will enable the webisite to send emails from the pi-plus.com.au domain:

Hi, I'm trying to authenticate our domain with MailerSend. Can you help me add these records, so that I can complete the process? You can add the records by clicking the following link: https://app.goentri.com/share/1d4d14a454954b2fa2a506571f37972d. Thank you for your help!

That's great news thanks Heath!

Not sure if relevant yet or only to live site but you had previously amended the back end to have a custom URL that's different from the standard WP one. (Request that came from Sree)
Would this be possible?

https://www.pi-plus.com.au/backend/

Could you kindly add me and Sree as users to the new staging environment, I have to finalise content tweaks.

Would the next steps be making any final content tweaks and then advising on a go live date for the switch over?
And then when to switch off old site.

Thanks so much for all your help,

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Hi Megs,

We have been trying to migrate the site, but the Fuller server or website is blocking our attempts.

Can you please ask them to supply a full backup of the database and directory of the site. We will then migrate it manually.

So sorry, here we go:

Fuller have deactivated ACF licensing, Wordfence licensing and removed our SMTP server details, so these are the few items that will need to be re-setup.

The W3 Total cache settings have been based on our environments, so please review / change this if necessary too.

To access staging please navigate to:

https://pip-staging.tt123.com.au/wp-admin/

Username: support@wolfiq.com.au
Password: #6A4hiG5A)ihJ#!!D9U7DZ$A

If you could please change your password on first login.

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au

www.pi-plus.com.au

Hi Megs,

We are yet to receive the logins. I think their SMTP server is not set up on staging, so the new user notification email can't be received. See attached. Can you please manually send our password, or ask them to?

I have requested them to add you guys so hopefully you receive a confirmation email soon. More feedback from them below - we will pause on all website changes until you guys are able to set it up in your environment per their note on a content freeze.


I think the ideal solution is for them to get the website up in their environment now, and you can then finish all content changes in their staging environment - that way we know the site has transferred with no issues and you are able to edit content - they can also then set up all the licensing needs.

This means that the site is then in their environment, has been tested by you and ready for go live (even if you need to continue making content changes right up until intended deployment).

All development has been completed / tested on our end so once migrated, we will consider their environment the true database. If you come across any functional / development issues during adding content that we need to fix, then we can provide them with code updates to apply.

Once we give them access, we would need to put a content freeze in place so that we can be sure all data has been migrated over to their servers.
Lovely thank you so much Heath - I will confirm as soon as they have done that.

Hi Meg,

It's looking great! Yes sure, we can migrate this site to a staging server at our end for you.

All we need is full WordPress admin access for support@wolfiq.com.au and we will migrate a copy of the site over.
